entry.title: Do Kwon and Terraform Labs Slapped With Class-Action Suit
entry.summary: The implosion of UST and LUNA vaporized tens of billions of dollars in value.

entry.title: ‘Silicon Valley’ Producers Tap Ethereum NFTs for User-Generated Comedy
entry.summary: With Hollywood veterans Alec Berg and Mike Judge on board, Terrible Pets will offer NFT-based tools for creating memes and viral content.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Crash More Than 30% as Recession Fears Loom
entry.summary: The Federal Reserve also introduced the biggest interest rate hike since 1994, and crypto lender Celsius evoked memories of Terra.

entry.title: Bitcoin Breaches $19,000, Ethereum Dips Below $1,000
entry.summary: The crypto market started the weekend with new lows as Ethereum and Bitcoin fell below key support levels.

entry.title: Bitcoin Falls Below $20,000, Ethereum Tests $1,000
entry.summary: Bitcoin plunged below $20,000 on Saturday morning, a significant support level for the top cryptocurrency. Ethereum approached $1,000.

entry.title: FBI Warns of Cryptocurrency Scammers on LinkedIn
entry.summary: Special agent said “fraudulent activity is significant” on the business-focused social network.

entry.title: Ethereum Layer-2 Immutable X Plots $500M Fund for NFT, Game Developers
entry.summary: Immutable Ventures will offer investment and grants—in IMX tokens and cash—for developers building on its Ethereum scaling solution.

entry.title: How Brands Should Approach NFTs and Web3: VaynerNFT
entry.summary: Gary Vaynerchuk and Avery Akkineni discuss helping Budweiser, Pepsi, and Behr enter and explore the Web3 space.

entry.title: Crypto Lending Platform Babel Finance Pauses Withdrawals, Citing ‘Liquidity Pressures’
entry.summary: The $2 billion fund has announced that it’s blocking customers from pulling out their assets, after a slump in the cryptocurrency market.

entry.title: GBTC Discount Hits All-Time Low as SEC Bitcoin ETF Decision Looms
entry.summary: The Grayscale Bitcoin Trust continues to trade at a discount, as the July deadline for its Bitcoin ETF application with the SEC draws ever nearer.

entry.title: BitMEX and Others Exiting Three Arrows Capital Amid 3AC Insolvency Fears
entry.summary: As Three Arrows Capital struggles, its lenders have started liquidating the firm's positions and portfolio companies are distancing themselves.

entry.title: Nexo Co-Founder: Crypto Crash 'Like Panic of 1907’
entry.summary: Nexo managing partner Antoni Trenchev reckons a consolidation of the crypto market is the next step required to overcome current struggles.

entry.title: ‘Pharma Bro’ Martin Shkreli Is Not Launching a DEX—But Says He's Working on Blockchain Software
entry.summary: Martin Shkreli refuted a press release claiming he was launching a DEX to compete with Uniswap—but says he's working on something else in crypto.

entry.title: MakerDAO Votes to Disable Aave DAI Supply, Reducing Celsius Exposure
entry.summary: In an effort to reduce exposure to Celsius, MakerDAO has disabled DAI loans using stETH as collateral through the Direct Deposit Module.

entry.title: 'Few Are Feeling OK': Celsius Investors Unlikely to Fund Bailout: Report
entry.summary: Leading investors in Celsius Network aren’t expected to back the embattled crypto lending company with additional funds.

entry.title: Elon Musk Reveals Crypto Twitter Plans in Leaked Transcript
entry.summary: Billionaire Tesla CEO Elon Musk expanded on his plans for Twitter, including crypto payments, in a leaked Q&A session with employees.

entry.title: Panama’s President Vetoes Law That Would Have Regulated Bitcoin, Legalized DAOs
entry.summary: The bill will now go back to the country’s National Assembly for debate.

entry.title: Solana’s New Gas Fees Won’t Make the Network 'Expensive,' Says Co-Founder
entry.summary: Solana’s new fee structure could lead to “gas wars” for big NFT drops, but it won’t cause fees to rise across the entire network like on Ethereum.

entry.title: Convicted Felon Anna Sorokin is Launching an NFT Collection
entry.summary: The fake heiress wants to sell NFTs that reportedly grant holders access to her.

entry.title: Dogecoin Deserves More Credit for Onboarding People to Crypto: Ex-Robinhood Exec
entry.summary: Dogecoin helped get people through the door, and NFTs can serve a similar aim, said Christine Brown, now COO and co-founder of NFT startup Floor.

entry.title: Who’s Firing—And Still Hiring—During the Bitcoin Bear Market
entry.summary: Some crypto companies are feeling the crunch of a market crash and reducing their employee headcount to cope—but others are still expanding and securing fresh talent. Here's who's hiring and firing in crypto right now.

entry.title: Regulators in Five States Target Celsius Over Withdrawal Freeze: Report
entry.summary: State securities regulators have opened investigations into the crypto lender's decision to freeze accounts, Texas’ enforcement director told Reuters.

entry.title: Most of the World’s Wealthiest Individuals Have Bought Digital Assets: Capgemini
entry.summary: A majority of millionaires polled for the Capgemini World Wealth Report have invested in digital assets including cryptocurrency.

entry.title: Elon Musk, Tesla and SpaceX Hit With $258 Billion Dogecoin Lawsuit
entry.summary: The lawsuit aims to represent a class of people who’ve lost money trading Dogecoin.

entry.title: Huobi Shutting Down in Thailand Following Agency Ruling
entry.summary: Thailand’s Securities and Exchange Commission has revoked the Huobi crypto exchange’s operating license in the country.

entry.title: Circle Launches Euro-Backed Stablecoin
entry.summary: Financial services company Circle today announced the launch of Euro Coin, a brand new stablecoin backed by Euro reserves.

entry.title: Mike Novogratz: Bitcoin Will 'Lead the Markets' in Recovery From Fed Rate Hike
entry.summary: Galaxy Digital CEO Mike Novogratz is cautiously optimistic that Bitcoin will play a key role in the recovery from the current downturn.

entry.title: BitMEX Co-Founder Benjamin Delo Avoids Prison Time, Receives 30 Months Probation
entry.summary: Delo’s recent settlement of $10 million with the CFTC prompted federal authorities to exercise some leniency in sentencing him.

entry.title: Mark Cuban: Crypto Firms Sustained by 'Cheap, Easy Money' Will Disappear in Crash
entry.summary: Billionaire Shark Tank star Mark Cuban predicts the demise of cryptocurrency projects that don’t have “valid business prospects.”

entry.title: Ethereum Jumps 10% as Bitcoin and Crypto Markets Stage Mini Rally
entry.summary: Top cryptocurrencies Bitcoin and Ethereum posted overnight gains following the Fed's rate hike, amid weakened on-chain user activity.

entry.title: Embattled Celsius CEO Alex Mashinsky Breaks 3-Day Silence
entry.summary: Mashinsky touted the strength of the Celsius community but gave no indication as to when customers would again be able to withdraw funds from the crypto lender.

entry.title: OpenSea Moves to Seaport Protocol to Cut Ethereum Gas Fees by 35%
entry.summary: The world's largest NFT marketplace pushes Wyvern overboard, finding safe harbor in Seaport.

entry.title: Is Multibillion-Dollar Hedge Fund Three Arrows Next to Unravel? Here’s What’s Going On
entry.summary: If two huge loans, which analysts believe belong to Three Arrows, get liquidated, it could be disastrous for crypto lenders and the credit market.

entry.title: TAG Heuer Wants You to Wear Your Bored Ape on Your Wrist
entry.summary: The move comes mere weeks after the luxury watchmaker began accepting cryptocurrency payments on its U.S. online store.

entry.title: Kraken CEO Doubles Down on Anti-Woke Culture, Says 'Triggered' Employees Should Leave
entry.summary: "The mission" above all, says CEO Jesse Powell, adding that "woke activists" among mostly new hires have been sapping company productivity.

entry.title: Ethereum Wallet MetaMask, Solana's Phantom Patch 'Demonic' Security Bug
entry.summary: The vulnerability meant that secret recovery phrases were sometimes stored on a user’s hard drive.

entry.title: Bitcoin Bounces as Fed Drops Biggest Interest Rate Hike Since 1994
entry.summary: Bitcoin again followed equities and dipped before recovering on the Fed’s latest interest rate hike.

entry.title: Superchief Gallery Embraces Degen Culture with Knife Throwing and NFTs
entry.summary: With physical NFT spaces in LA and NYC, these aren’t your typical art galleries.

entry.title: ApeCoin Hits New Low as Ethereum, Bored Ape NFT Prices Tumble
entry.summary: The Ethereum-based token is down 65% over the last 30 days, crashing harder than other gaming and virtual land tokens.

entry.title: Tether Hits Back at ‘Rumors’ Regarding its Commercial Paper Portfolio
entry.summary: The stablecoin provider issued a statement pushing back at ‘false rumors’ that its USDT coin is largely backed by Chinese and Asian commercial paper.

entry.title: NFTs and Knife-Throwing Abound at Superchief Gallery in LA
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin talks to Superchief Gallery co-founder Edward Ed Zipco about NFTs and the potential for digital art at Superchief's 10 anniversary showing in Los Angeles.

entry.title: #DecryptLive: Luxury Fashion Brands Are Going Crypto
entry.summary: From Dolce & Gabbana to Balmain, big names in fashion are embracing crypto and NFTs. Decrypt's Stephen Graves, Dan Roberts, Sander Lutz and contributor Alys Keys discuss the trend.

entry.title: Collateralized Monkey JPEGs: CEO of Arcade Talks to Decrypt at Consensus
entry.summary: Arcade, an NFT liquidity provider, says it's facilitating $25 million in loans against blue-chip NFTs like Bored Apes. Arcade CEO Gabe Frank talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Consensus 2022.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: What is a Dapp?
entry.summary: A dapp is a decentralized app built on blockchains to give you more ownership and freedom in your digital life. Dapps are the next generation of software. Explore the vast selection of dapps on Ethereum today. Curious how to build dapps? Start building free at infura.io.

entry.title: Bringing 'Snow Crash' to Life: Neal Stephenson Talks to Decrypt at Consensus
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson, who coined the term "metaverse" in his seminal novel "Snow Crash," speaks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson along with Bitcoin Foundation founder Peter Vessenes, about the new "free metaverse" they're co-launching, Lamina1.

entry.title: Edge CEO Paul Puey Talks 'Confidential' Bitcoin Mastercard Launch
entry.summary: Paul Puey, CEO of Edge Wallet, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson about Edge's announcement of a new "confidential" crypto Mastercard. After Edge announced the card on Wednesday, Mastercard blasted crypto media to say it has nothing to do with the product—despite Puey telling Decrypt, "MasterCard is involved in entire process. They fully approved this, it’s fully legal and approved by MasterCard. It fits entirely within their framework.”

entry.title: gm: Christine Brown Left Robinhood to Go Full NFT
entry.summary: Christine Brown left her perch as Robinhood Crypto COO at the end of March to launch a new crypto venture. Now she has announced her new gig: Co-founder and COO at Floor, a token-gated NFT portfolio app that has raised an $8 million seed round. She talked to Decrypt's Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about the company's plans, her own crypto and NFT bags, and her outlook on NFTs and on Robinhood.

entry.title: NBA's Spencer Dinwiddie Talks $26M Raise for Social Crypto App Calaxy
entry.summary: Spencer Dinwiddie's creator token platform Calaxy has raised another $26 million in funding. Dinwiddie tells Decrypt's Stacy Elliott what makes Calaxy stand out and why it can succeed.

entry.title: How To Change the 'NFTs Are Bad' Narrative: UnicornDAO Co-Founder Rebecca Lamis
entry.summary: Rebecca Lamis, who co-founded UnicornDAO with Nadya Tolokonnikova of the band Pussy Riot, sits down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson in Justin Aversano's new Quantum Art physical NFT space to discuss diversity and inclusion in Web3.

entry.title: Twin Flames Creator Justin Aversano Opens Physical NFT Space in LA
entry.summary: Quantum's Justin Aversano sits down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at the new Quantum Spaces in Santa Monica, CA. Justin discusses the gallery, his new project Doppelganger, and what's next for real-world NFT exhibitions.

entry.title: NFTs with Utility: STEPN, NFTY Labs, Wax, and Gomu Predict What's Next
entry.summary: Shiti Manghani of STEPN, Ty Blackard of NFTY Labs, William Quigley of Wax blockchain, and Spencer Yang of Gomu talk with Decrypt's Dan Roberts about how the next era of NFTs will have utility and real-world use cases, as part of CoinMarketCap's The Capital virtual conference.

entry.title: Kraken's Dan Held Talks Bitcoin Maximalism and Crypto Winter
entry.summary: Dan Held, a longtime Bitcoin influencer and now head of growth marketing at crypto exchange Kraken, talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts about Bitcoin maximalists (he calls himself a "mostamalist"), NFTs, and Crypto Winter as part of CoinMarketCap's The Capital virtual conference.

entry.title: What Is Runner? 'Hunger Games' Co-Producer's Web3 Sci-Fi Project
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin speaks with Hollywood producer Bryan Unkeless and team members Bryce Anderson and Blaise Hemingway about their Web3 sci-fi project Runner, starting with an NFT project and a comic book all about racing.

entry.title: ‘The Irishman’ Exec Producer Niels Juul Gets Into NFTs
entry.summary: Decrypt’s Kate Irwin talks to veteran Hollywood film producer Niels Juul about why he’s going all in on NFTs and Web3.

entry.title: Decrypt at Cannes: Decentralized Pictures CEO Leo Matchett Talks Hollywood Embracing Crypto
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stephen Graves heads to the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, where he sits down with Leo Matchett of Decentralized Pictures, the Roman Coppola-backed nonprofit using crypto and blockchain voting to find, fund, and produce films.

entry.title: Decrypt at Cannes: 'Calladita' Director Miguel Faus on Funding Films with NFTs
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stephen Graves is on the scene at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, where he spoke to Miguel Faus, director of the film "Calladita," who funded his movie by selling NFTs to backers including NounsDAO.

entry.title: gm: DraftKings Goes Crypto
entry.summary: Episode 10 of the gm podcast: Crypto and sports continue to converge, and one of the best examples is DraftKings. CEO Jason Robins joins Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts to talk about how DraftKings is embracing NFTs as prizes, when the company might accept crypto for entry fees and bets, and how his experience dealing with regulators and lawmakers mirrors what crypto companies are now going through in Washington.
